effect->Spell Effect: Fly.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.MuRBCiZn5IKeaoxi]

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}

The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

action->Reactive Strike (Special).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]
Reactive Strike (Special)
action->Reactive Strike (Special).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]

The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

action->Command Giants.name: Command Giants
action->Command Giants.description: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35

action->Demand.name: Demand
action->Demand.description: When a rune giant casts their innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R9xqCBblkS5KE4y7]{Sending} spell, they can also cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target.

action->Flashing Runes.name: Flashing Runes
action->Flashing Runes.description:
Trigger The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell

Effect The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

action->Invoke Rune.name: Invoke Rune
action->Invoke Rune.description:
The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a @Template[cone|distance:30] of sparks that deals @Damage[6d12[electricity]] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save).

The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Invoke Rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

  • Rune of Destruction The weapon gains the deadly trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.
  • Rune of Flames The weapon deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage on all attacks.
  • Rune of Smiting When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.
  • Rune of Space During the rune giant's turn, the weapon's reach is increased to 60 feet.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
action->Wide Swing.description: The rune giant makes a single greatsword Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.

Sargassum Heap.name: Sargassum Heap
Sargassum Heap.publicNotes: A sargassum heap is a mass of semi-intelligent seaweed that floats through the ocean, luring in its victims with hallucinogenic spores. Those affected by the spores are drawn towards the heap, envisioning their heart's desire. This might be a lost loved one, a child in need of help, an enchanting mermaid, the promise of dry land, and so on. Once their prey is close enough, the sargassum heap lashes out with its seaweed tendrils and crushes it to death.

action->Wavesense (Precise) 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Precise) 60 feet

action->Mirage Spores.name: Mirage Spores
action->Mirage Spores.description:
120 feet.

The sargassum heap constantly produces a field of hallucinogenic spores that causes those affected to see the monster as whatever they desire most. Each creature within the emanation must succeed a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the sargassum heap and compelled to move toward it on the creature's turn. Creatures fascinated this way are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the sargassum heap attacks, the fascinated condition ends only for the creature that is attacked. On a successful save, a creature is temporarily immune to mirage spores for 24 hours.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(2d8+3)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Sarglagon.name: Sarglagón
Sarglagon.publicNotes:
Los sarglagones habitan en los innumerables cursos de agua, lagos y océanos del Infierno. Sirven como guardianes de la Academia de las Mentiras, el depósito de secretos de Estigia, la quinta capa del Infierno. Los sarglagones respiran agua y aire con la misma facilidad y pueden desplazarse por agua, tierra e incluso por el aire con una rapidez asombrosa. Pocos infernales viajan por las vías fluviales del multiverso, pero allí donde un río cruza los Planos, lo más probable es que los sarglagones lo hayan recorrido para llevar a cabo sus maquinaciones infernales. La única masa de agua que evitan es el río Estigia, ya que los infernales aún no han desarrollado ninguna defensa contra las cualidades de estas aguas, que les hacen perder la memoria. Los lanzadores de conjuros mortales en ocasiones ligan a los sarglagones como guardianes de preciosos secretos o tesoros, especialmente en zonas acuáticas. Lo más extraño es que a veces actúan como inquietantes cuidadores de mortales que no tienen ni idea de lo que hicieron para ganarse la atención de sus indeseados protectores. La constante vigilancia indeseada de estos diablos suele ser molesta y agobiante para sus pupilos.

Maestros de la corrupción y arquitectos de la conquista, los diablos buscan tanto tentar a la vida mortal para que se una a su búsqueda de todo lo profano como extender la tiranía por todos los mundos. Las tentaciones que ofrecen a los mortales van desde grandes poderes concedidos por la firma de un contrato infernal a retorcidos favores tras una promesa susurrada a un patrón diabólico, o cualquier número de intercambios aún más sutiles. Quienes sucumben a estas tentaciones se ven abocados a una vida después de la muerte de tormento sin fin en las fosas del Infierno, donde la única esperanza de escapar reside en la posibilidad de ser ascendido a demonio en las filas infernales.

Cada diablo tiene un papel específico que desempeñar en el mantenimiento de la implacable maquinaria burocrática que es el Infierno, desde soldados y eruditos hasta inquisidores, abogados, jueces y verdugos. Los ortos más humildes realizan labores serviles a los diablos más poderosos y especializados, como la infantería y los diablos contratados, mientras que los grandes nessaris comandan ejércitos infernales enteros.

Asmodeus se encuentra en la cúspide de la estructura que él mismo creó, pero las capas inferiores están marcadas por una constante lucha por la posición. La mayoría de los planes diabólicos sirven en última instancia para mejorar el lugar del intrigante en la jerarquía.
Sarglagon.saveDetails: +1 por estatus a todas las salvaciones contra magia

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name: Telepatía 100 pies (30 m)

action->Heavy Aura.name: Aura pesada
action->Heavy Aura.description:
10 pies (3 m)

Una criatura que entre en el aura pesada debe hacer una salvación de @Check[will|dc:23]. Entonces, se vuelve temporalmente inmune durante 10 minutos.

Éxito La criatura no se ve afectada.

Fallo La criatura se ve afectada mientras permanezca en el área. Si la criatura ya está afectada, queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizada} mientras permanezca dentro del aura.

Fallo crítico Como con el fallo, pero el efecto persiste durante 3 asaltos una vez que se abandone el aura.

action->Stygian Guardian.name: Guardían estigio
action->Stygian Guardian.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura u objeto al alcance del sarglagón es objetivo de un ataque

Efecto El sarglagón se interpone, ofreciéndole a la criatura u objeto una @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{cobertura estándar} contra el ataque (bonificador +2 por circunstancia a la CA), o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{cobertura mayor} (bonificador +4 por circunstancia a la CA) si ya le estaba ofreciendo cobertura menor.

action->Drown.name: Ahogar
action->Drown.description:
El sarglagón conjura agua turbia para llenar los pulmones de una criatura que no pueda respirar agua en un radio de 30 pies (9 m). El objetivo debe hacer una salvación de @Check[fortitude|dc:26].

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo tose el agua y queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1}.

Fallo El objetivo aguanta la respiración. La única acción que puede llevar a cabo es hacer una salvación de Fortaleza contra Ahogar para expulsar el agua, que es una acción única.

Fallo crítico El objetivo queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente} y comienza a asfixiarse. Si el objetivo tiene éxito en su salvación de Fortaleza mientras se asfixia, tose el agua y puede volver a respirar.

action->Sarglagon Venom.name: Veneno de sarglagón
action->Sarglagon Venom.description:
Tirada de salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Duración máxima 6 asaltos

Etapa 1@Damage[2d6[poison]]{2d6 de daño por veneno} y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 1} (1 asalto)

Etapa 2@Damage[3d6[poison]]{3d6 de daño por veneno} y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 2} (1 asalto)

Satyr.name: Satyr
Satyr.publicNotes:
To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited. Notorious for their hedonism, these fey believe there's no greater beauty than can be found in song, drink, indulgent meals, and carnal pleasures. Satyrs use their enchanting songs and natural charm to encourage all manner of people to follow their true desires and free themselves from society's rules. This usually involves enticing mortals to join raucous parties or engage in trysts in moonlit glades. If a potential companion rejects a satyr's advances, however, the satyr has little interest in continuing a conversation and goes off to find more amenable revelers.

The lifestyle of a satyr leaves no room for ongoing affairs or long-term friends. Once his party is over or his lust is satiated, the satyr disappears back into the forest. The offspring satyrs leave behind are satyrs themselves, and they usually end up being taken from their cradles by other fey rather than left in mortals' care. Satyrs are always male.

The untouched beauty of the forest is sacred and precious to a satyr. Brutish intruders who clear-cut trees or massacre animals without eating them risk drawing a satyr's ire. A satyr so provoked uses his spells to undermine foes and attempts to dispatch them either with brutal ambushes or by leading a rush of forest animals to attack.

Other fey, particularly more benevolent fey, look upon satyrs as loutish, embarrassing cousins. They're rarely hostile toward satyrs, but most find them insufferable and advise any mortals they like to steer clear of satyrs' glades.

equipment->Wineskin.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.VnPh324pKwd2ZB66]
Wineskin

equipment->Panpipes.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPv5Yx4w7scZGj2Y]
Panpipes

action->Sylvan Wine.name: Sylvan Wine
action->Sylvan Wine.description:
A satyr's wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an Interact action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and a +3 item bonus to Will saves against fear effects for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr's person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QDs8t1U1IepzYlyi]{Effect: Sylvan Wine}

action->Fleet Performer.name: Fleet Performer
action->Fleet Performer.description: When the satyr Plays the Pipes to cast a spell, he can Step or Stride as part of the activity.

action->Play the Pipes.name: Play the Pipes
action->Play the Pipes.description:
Requirements The satyr is holding a musical instrument.

Effect The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} without expending the spell slot.

The spell gains the auditory trait and targets all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60] instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr's pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.

Scarecrow.name: Scarecrow
Scarecrow.publicNotes:
A ramshackle collection of materials in a human shape, the scarecrow construct is indistinguishable from a normal scarecrow until it slowly creaks to life. As it animates, its carved pumpkin or sackcloth face bursts into eldritch flame, sending fear creeping into the air around it. Each scarecrow is handcrafted and unique in its appearance, though most are 5 to 6 feet tall and constructed of a combination of wood, cloth, rope, straw, sawdust, discarded husks and cobs, and similar materials, all dressed in ragged pastoral garments. This rudimentary construction makes a scarecrow somewhat fragile, prone to snapping limbs in the crush of battle. Yet its structure is adaptable, allowing it to reshape another piece of itself into a clawed limb or grip a severed portion of itself to swat at its foes.

When a scarecrow is created, it must be anointed with a drop of its creator's blood into each of its eyes. This blood soaks into the material and siphons a tiny sliver of the creator's soul away—not enough to harm the creator, but more than enough to imbue the scarecrow with an instinctive intellect that allows it to follow commands as eagerly as a well-trained (if ill-tempered) guard dog. When a scarecrow is destroyed, the blood leaks back out from its eyes, but the portion of the creator's soul never returns.

action->Scarecrow's Leer.name: Scarecrow's Leer
action->Scarecrow's Leer.description:
40 feet.

The scarecrow's eyes flicker with an unnerving glow. A creature can't reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition below 1 as long as it is in the aura's emanation. When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. Birds and other avian creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to this save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the scarecrow until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

action->Baleful Glow.name: Baleful Glow
action->Baleful Glow.description: The scarecrow's head bursts into ghostly, heatless flame that sheds bright light in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (and dim light to the next 20 feet). If the scarecrow uses this ability on the first round of combat, any creature that has not acted yet is startled and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the scarecrow for 1 round. It can suppress the light by using this action again.

action->Clawing Fear.name: Clawing Fear
action->Clawing Fear.description: The scarecrow's strikes deal an additional @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.

action->Mundane Appearance.name: Mundane Appearance
action->Mundane Appearance.description: Until it acts, the scarecrow resembles an ordinary scarecrow. It has an automatic result of 32 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary scarecrow.

Scorpion Swarm.name: Plaga de escorpiones
Scorpion Swarm.publicNotes:
Si un solo escorpión ya es de por sí peligroso, las plagas de dichas sabandijas pueden ser directamente devastadoras. Estas oleadas de muerte correteante abaten a sus presas antes de devorarlas por completo, excepto los huesos.

Azotes quitinosos de los desiertos, los bosques, las sabanas y los yermos, los escorpiones son arácnidos mortales con potentes pinzas y un doloroso aguijón. Se les puede hallar en prácticamente cualquier clima, donde persiguen a sus presas con una mezcla de sigilo paciente y fuerza bruta. La mayor parte de ellos viven en madrigueras subterráneas, o bien como cazadores solitarios, o bien como parte de una colonia mayor. Estos arácnidos son tan temidos y peligrosos, que en muchas culturas se les trata como dioses o como símbolos dualistas, tanto de la muerte como de la protección contra dicha muerte.

action->Scorpion Venom.name: Veneno de escorpión
action->Scorpion Venom.description:
Tirada de Salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Duración máxima 6 asaltos

Etapa 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]{1d6 daño por veneno} (1 asalto)

Etapa 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]{1d6 daño por veneno} y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 1} (1 asalto)

action->Swarming Stings.name: Aguijonazos de plaga
action->Swarming Stings.description: Cada enemigo en el espacio de la plaga sufre @Damage[2d8[piercing]]{2d8 daño perforante} (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic]) y queda expuesto al veneno de escorpión.

Sea Hag.name: Sea Hag
Sea Hag.publicNotes:
Sea hags specialize in transformation magic, preying on those who are desperate to change some aspect of their physical appearance. Targets often include those suffering from insecurity about their bodies or those desperate to reside in a different environment, such as aquatic creatures who wish to live on land. These hags are known for tempting desperate victims into tragic and excruciating bargains, though they're also happy to drown and eat mariners who stray too close to their dwellings.

A sea hag has the upper half of a humanoid and the lower half of an octopus, with translucent skin and glowing lights visible beneath their flesh. Sea hags can join covens, but their aquatic nature often prevents them from joining mixed covens with other kinds of hags.

Hags are malevolent predators who use magic and manipulation to lure children and young adults into their clutches. Though their true forms are eldritch and horrifying, hags spend much of their lives disguised as ordinary women. They seek out targets who are unhappy, innocent, or otherwise vulnerable, preying on their weaknesses before snatching them up. The typical hag is abusive, controlling, and narcissistic. Though less malicious hags possibly exist, they rarely reveal their true forms, making them nearly impossible to find.
Sea Hag.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Coven.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.52CdldlWMiVTZk1F]

A sea hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to their coven's spells. Their spell DC when leading a coven is 20.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

action->Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
action->Sea Hag's Bargain.description:
The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality—such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice. In exchange, the sea hag spends 1 minute polymorphing the creature into a form the target desires.

This functions as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}. It might be a total transformation or just changing one or more aspects of the target's body, and it can't make the creature more than one size smaller or larger. The creature changes its Speeds as appropriate for the new form. It doesn't change the attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type the Strikes deal. This has an unlimited duration, and as long as it's transformed, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce its sickened condition below 2. The creature can slowly and carefully eat and drink despite being sickened. The only way to restore the lost quality used as payment is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return. Ending the bargain in this way also removes the transformation.

action->Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
action->Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its @Check[will|dc:20] save. The target doesn't need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is frightened 1 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Sea Serpent.name: Serpiente marina
Sea Serpent.publicNotes:
Estas fabulosas bestias parecen serpientes colosales, con largas crestas espinadas recorriendo su espalda. Temperamentales y territoriales, las serpientes marinas pueden hacer zozobrar un bote con facilidad y la mayor parte de ellas no dudan en hacerlo si tienen hambre o se sienten amenazadas. Abundan los relatos sobre capitanes agraviados que se pasan la vida persiguiendo al esquivo monstruo que hundió su barco y le arruinó la vida. Estas persecuciones se basan en rumores y atisbos de las bestias, puesto que pocos sobreviven a las catástrofes provocadas por una serpiente marina.

Mientras que muchos relatos de pescadores las pintan como guardianas del océano designadas por los dioses o bien como

action->Undetectable.name: Indetectable
action->Undetectable.description: Una serpiente marina hace una prueba de contrarrestar contra cualquier efecto de detección, escudriñamiento o revelación hecho contra ella, utilizando su modificador por @Check[stealth] como modificador a contrarrestar.

action->Capsize.name: Zozobrar
action->Capsize.description: La serpiente marina trata de hacer zozobrar un navío acuático de su tamaño o más pequeño al que está adyacente. Debe tener éxito en una prueba de @Check[athletics|dc:35] con una CD de 35 (reducida en 5 por cada tamaño menor que la serpiente marina) o la CD de Saber (navegar) del timonel, la mayor de ambas cosas.

action->Constrict.description:
@Damage[(1d10+14)[bludgeoning]]{1d10+14 contundente}, @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Sea Serpent Algae.name: Algas de serpiente marina
action->Sea Serpent Algae.description:
El agua de los órganos de lastre alrededor del cuello de la serpiente marina está llena de algas psicotrópicas.

Tirada de Salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Duración máxima 6 asaltos

Etapa 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confundido} y, si está volando, invierte su primera acción de cada turno en descender 20 pies (6 m) (1 asalto)

Etapa 2 confundido y, si está volando, desciende hasta llegar al suelo o al agua que tiene debajo (1 asalto)

action->Spine Rake.name: Espinas desgarradoras
action->Spine Rake.description: La serpiente marina extiende las espinas que tiene en el lomo y Nada o da una Zancada. Cada criatura a la que la serpiente está adyacente en cualquier punto de su movimiento sufre @Damage[(4d6+8)[slashing]]{4d6+8 daño cortante}, con una salvación @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic].

action->Swallow Whole.description:
Enorme, @Damage[(2d10+6)[bludgeoning]]{2d10+6 contundente}, Liberarse 20

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Sedacthy Marauder.name: Sedacthy Marauder
Sedacthy Marauder.publicNotes:
Physically imposing sedacthies prove their status by controlling dangerous aquatic creatures like great white sharks and giant moray eels.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

action->Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
action->Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Vengeful Throw.name: Vengeful Throw
action->Vengeful Throw.description:
Trigger The marauder takes damage from a creature 20 feet or further away

Effect The marauder makes a ranged spear Strike against the triggering creature. This attack doesn't take a range increment penalty if the target is within the second range increment.

action->Challenging Shriek.name: Challenging Shriek
action->Challenging Shriek.description:
The marauder unleashes a terrifying battle cry. Each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. Regardless of the results, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

action->Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
action->Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

Sedacthy Scout.name: Sedacthy Scout
Sedacthy Scout.publicNotes:
Scouts, usually young sedacthies, ply the ocean in search of animal servants or tread ashore to hunt. Scouts hunting on the surface press crocodiles and snakes into service, while those underwater prefer electric eels and hippocampi.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

action->Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
action->Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
action->Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

action->Wriggling Rush.name: Wriggling Rush
action->Wriggling Rush.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect The scout takes a Stride action and a Swim action, in either order. They ignore difficult terrain from mud, quicksand, and similar terrain during this movement.

Sedacthy Speaker.name: Sedacthy Speaker
Sedacthy Speaker.publicNotes:
High-ranking sedacthies are expected to both plan campaigns and wade into battle. These speakers achieve their rank by accumulating several large servants or a single massive creature like a megalodon.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

action->Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
action->Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Speaker's Privilege.name: Speaker's Privilege
action->Speaker's Privilege.description:
Trigger The sedacthy speaker takes damage

Requirements The sedacthy speaker has cover from an animal ally

Effect The animal takes the damage instead.

action->Animal Shield.name: Animal Shield
action->Animal Shield.description:
Requirements The sedacthy speaker is adjacent to a Large or larger animal ally

Effect The speaker gains cover until the start of their next turn or when they're no longer adjacent to the animal, whichever comes first.

action->Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
action->Exploit Weakness.description: The speaker's Strikes deal 1d6 additional damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}.

action->Painful Cry.name: Painful Cry
action->Painful Cry.description: The sedacthy shrieks across a range of painfully high tones, dealing @Damage[3d6[sonic],1d6[mental]]{3d6 sonic damage and 1d6 mental damage} to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30], with a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

action->Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
action->Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

action->Swim Together.name: Swim Together
action->Swim Together.description:
Requirements The speaker is adjacent to an animal ally

Effect The speaker and the animal both Swim, ending their movement adjacent to one another.

Seraptis.name: Seraptis
Seraptis.publicNotes:
Four-armed seraptis demons are radical nihilists at heart, despising other creatures out of bitter entitlement and laughing hysterically when others die or suffer. They arise from souls that engaged in dedicated campaigns of misery, driving their victims toward despair and suicide. After their awakening as a seraptis, the hungry mouths carved into their arms devour others' suffering, bringing a lively hue to the demon's cold skin.

These demons seek to drag mortals down to their level, luring pawns into deepseated resentment. Feeding their targets an unending stream of half-truths and propaganda, they often drive these mortals to vent their rage into unforgivable deeds against innocents. Although thrilled by the misery their mortal pawns inflict, the demons' true comfort is to harvest the souls of those pawns as more of their kind.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.
Seraptis.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

spell->Truesight (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]
Truesight (Constant)

spell->Truespeech (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
Truespeech (Constant)

spell->Translocate (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Translocate (At Will)

spell->Illusory Disguise (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]
Illusory Disguise (At Will)

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepathy 100 feet

action->Blood Healing.name: Blood Healing
action->Blood Healing.description:
30 feet.

Whenever a humanoid within the aura takes bleed damage, the blood flows through the air to the seraptis's mouths and the seraptis heals by the same amount.

action->Recovery Vulnerability.name: Recovery Vulnerability
action->Recovery Vulnerability.description: When a creature within the seraptis's blood healing aura recovers from persistent damage, the seraptis takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Bloody Dance.name: Bloody Dance
action->Bloody Dance.description: The seraptis makes a Strike with up to four arms, each against a different target and using a claw or scimitar as appropriate. These attacks count toward the seraptis's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks. The seraptis can use Grab following this activity, separately attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} each creature hit by a claw.

action->Gnawing Arms.name: Gnawing Arms
action->Gnawing Arms.description:
Requirements The seraptis has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The seraptis's arm mouths gnaw on those creatures, dealing each of them @Damage[(2d6+8)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save. Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 persistent bleed damage}.

action->Isolating Words.name: Isolating Words
action->Isolating Words.description:
The seraptis telepathically explains a plausible secret to a creature within 30 feet. That creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:37] save or be mentally cut off from those around them for 1 minute (or permanently on a critical failure). The affected creature treats no one as an ally and any speech they hear is warped, encouraging conflict, and negating any linguistic ability from creatures that aren't unholy.

Regardless of the results of the saving throw, the creature is immune to Isolating Words for 24 hours.

Sewer Ooze.name: Sewer Ooze
Sewer Ooze.publicNotes:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Filth Wave.name: Filth Wave
action->Filth Wave.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or take @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage and take a –10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).

A creature can spend an Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Qomp2EujVCbzJb4X]{Effect: Filth Wave}

Shadow.name: Sombra
Shadow.publicNotes: Los misteriosos muertos vivientes conocidos como sombras acechan en lugares oscuros y se alimentan de quienes se alejan demasiado de la luz.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Vulnerabilidad a la luz
action->Light Vulnerability.description: Los ataques contra una sombra se tratan como mágicos si los lleva a cabo una criatura que está en una luz mágica o con un objeto que está en una luz mágica (como la del conjuro @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Luz}).

action->Shadow Spawn.name: Engendro sombrío
action->Shadow Spawn.description:
Cuando la sombra de una criatura es arrancada mediante robar sombra, esta se convierte en un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Engendro sombrío} bajo las órdenes de la sombra que la creó. Este engendro no tiene la aptitud Robar sombra y está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 2} de forma perpetua e incurable.

Si la criatura a quien se arrancó la sombra muere, el engendro se convierte en una sombra verdadera y autónoma. Si la criatura se recobra de su debilitamiento, su sombra retorna a ella y el engendro se extingue.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Escabullirse en las sombras
action->Slink in Shadows.description: La sombra puede @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Esconderse} o acabar su @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Movimiento furtivo} en la sombra de una criatura o de un objeto.

action->Steal Shadow.name: Robar sombra
action->Steal Shadow.description:
Requisitos La sombra ha acertado a una criatura viva con un Golpe de mano sombría en su acción anterior

Efecto La sombra tira de la sombra del objetivo, dejando a la criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitada 1}. Esto es acumulativo con otros estados de debilitado debido a las sombras, hasta un máximo de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 4}. Si incrementa el estado de debilitado de una criatura a 3 o más, la sombra del objetivo queda separada de su cuerpo (ver engendro sombrío). El valor de debilitado de Robar sombra disminuye en 1 cada hora.

Shadow Giant.name: Shadow Giant
Shadow Giant.publicNotes:
Shadow giants are natives of the Netherworld, where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia. They live in familiar groups and uphold a nomadic way of life as they roam across ancestral lands between shadowy forests and misty chasms. These hunter-gatherers pass down lore through oral histories, conduct pilgrimages to unholy ziggurats of black stone, and bathe in the blood of their long-standing foes, including rival shadow giant clans and fiends of the Netherworld intent on enslaving their kind.

Standing 15 feet tall, with gray skin and hair only a shade lighter, shadow giants are fearsome foes with a well-earned reputation as zealous warmongers and ruthless combatants. They rarely interact with outsiders, though they may treat with proven warriors who show the giants the respect and deference they feel they deserve.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

action->Pall of Shadow.name: Pall of Shadow
action->Pall of Shadow.description: When a shadow giant hits with a melee attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and take a –1 status penalty to Perception checks involving sight as long as they remain drained. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic.

action->Shadow Chain.name: Shadow Chain
action->Shadow Chain.description: Shadows extend the giant's chain as they make a spiked chain Strike, increasing their reach to 60 feet for that Strike. If this hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33] save or be teleported to an empty space within the shadow giant's normal reach.

action->Shadowcloak.name: Shadowcloak
action->Shadowcloak.description: The shadow giant gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur} spell for 1 minute or until it is exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first.

Shadow Spawn.name: Engendro sombrío
Shadow Spawn.publicNotes: Los misteriosos muertos vivientes conocidos como sombras acechan en lugares oscuros y se alimentan de quienes se alejan demasiado de la luz.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Vulnerabilidad a la luz
action->Light Vulnerability.description: Los ataques contra una sombra se tratan como mágicos si los lleva a cabo una criatura que está en una luz mágica o con un objeto que está en una luz mágica (como la del conjuro @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Luz}).

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Escabullirse en las sombras
action->Slink in Shadows.description: La sombra puede @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Esconderse} o acabar su @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Movimiento furtivo} en la sombra de una criatura o de un objeto.

Shemhazian.name: Shemhazian
Shemhazian.publicNotes:
Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of claws, pincers, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those they encounter.

Shemhazians delight in tormenting mortals, of course, but more than most demons, they revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to their allies along with any foe.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.
Shemhazian.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

A shemhazian can't use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.

Shining Child.name: Vástago brillante
Shining Child.publicNotes:
Los vástagos brillantes son monstruos viles y enigmáticos, que vagan por Planos remotos y por rincones ignotos del Universo en busca de sabiduría esotérica. Con su figura anormalmente demacrada, su cabello largo y blanco y sus inquietantes manos de cuatro dedos, son a la vez extrañamente familiares y de apariencia ultraterrenal, aunque son apenas visibles en el sudario de luz cegadora que emiten continuamente.

Sin embargo, su rostro es auténticamente horrible, puesto que sus ojos sobredimensionados y su boca desencajada revelan que su cabeza es un vacío lleno de una luz antinatural. Los vástagos brillantes utilizan esta luz como arma, tejiendo ilusiones y haces concentrados de brillantez abrasadora.

Dada su reputación como eruditos de lo ajeno y de lo alienígena, a veces les convocan poderosos magos ocultistas en busca de conocimientos raros. Las criaturas jamás entregan su saber sin cobrarse un precio y, típicamente, exigen a cambio que se lleven a cabo actos despreciables que benefician a sus inescrutables planes a largo plazo.

Estos misteriosos seres son nativos del Plano Astral. En dicho vasto Plano, la materia metafísica se acumula gradualmente y acaba por consolidarse en forma de semiplanos. Durante tan tumultuoso proceso, a veces se desprenden chispas de luz viviente de los Planos recién formados y dichas chispas de energía planaria en bruto se acaban transformando de alguna forma en vástagos brillantes. Cada semiplano recién formado deja una impronta mental diferente en sus luminosos «hijos», haciendo fácil para los vástagos brillantes reconocer telepáticamente a sus hermanos y hermanas. Atrapados para siempre en cuerpos aparentemente adolescentes, los vástagos brillantes se dedican a la erudición y a la violencia en igual medida, en un fútil esfuerzo para entender su papel en el multiverso y la ardiente injusticia de su nacimiento.

Los vástagos brillantes confunden a la mayoría de criaturas con su negativa a usar nombres individuales, prefiriendo alternar entre referirse entre sí de forma singular y colectiva.

strike-ranged->Fire Ray.name: Rayo de fuego
strike-ranged->Fire Ray.description: @Damage[2d10[vitality]]{2d10 daño por vitalidad} si el objetivo es un muerto viviente.

action->Radiance Dependence.name: Dependencia radiante
action->Radiance Dependence.description: El vástago brillante está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} en áreas de oscuridad.

action->Blinding Aura.name: Aura cegadora
action->Blinding Aura.description:
60 pies (18 m).

El vástago brillante proyecta una luz intensa. Toda criatura que inicia su turno en el aura debe tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[fortitude|dc:29]. Si falla, queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Cegada} durante 1 minuto y, si falla críticamente, queda cegada de forma permanente. Una criatura que tiene éxito en su salvación queda temporalmente inmune a este efecto durante 24 horas.

action->Overwhelming Light.name: Luz abrumadora
action->Overwhelming Light.description:
Desencadenante El vástago brillante entra en un área de oscuridad mágica o empieza su turno en un área de oscuridad mágica

Efecto El vástago brillante hace una prueba de contrarrestar contra la oscuridad mágica (rango de contrarrestar 7, modificador a contrarrestar [[/r 1d20+23 #Contrarrestar]]{+23}).

Shuln.name: Shuln
Shuln.publicNotes:
Scourges of the upper Darklands, these enormous, mole-like monstrosities slice and burrow through solid stone with massive forearms and adamantine-strong claws. Shulns grow to about 20 feet long and have four tiny, nearly imperceptible eyes; a long, pale snout; four thick-muscled legs that end in long, serrated claws; and a stubby pink tail. As a young shuln matures, its unique metabolism produces adamantine that becomes infused throughout its skeletal system. In addition to making their claws and fangs nearly unbreakable, this unique physiological trait makes shulns unparalleled burrowers and highly sought by monster hunters who hope to harvest the precious material from their corpses.

Shulns have a ravenous appetite and eat nearly anything they can catch, but their preferred diet consists almost entirely of large invertebrates, especially cave worms. They rely on tiny sensory whiskers that cover their snouts and allow them to detect subtle movements in the air and ground without the use of vision. When they detect suitable prey, shulns bite their target at the first opportunity, injecting it with a potent paralytic toxin present in their saliva. So strong is this poison that it's capable of subduing even the near-unstoppable cave worm, making shulns a valuable (if dangerous) companion to anyone making excursions into worm-infested regions of the Darklands. Shulns' notoriously ill-tempered dispositions and their knack for digging into areas of an underground settlement where digging ought not to occur make them frustrating creatures to keep around, but when the alternative is an unpredictable but deadly visit from an enormous, hungry cave worm, the annoyances are well worth the trouble.

Encounters with much larger shuln-like entities on the Plane of Earth suggest that these creatures may have originated from there. The larger shulns still retain their elemental qualities, are quite a bit smarter, and have their own suite of earth-themed innate primal spells—but for all that, they still love the taste of cave worm.

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Skeletal Champion.name: Campeón esquelético
Skeletal Champion.publicNotes:
Estos esqueletos conservan la astucia que tenían en vida.

Los esqueletos animados son uno de los tipos de muerto viviente más comunes.

Skeletal Giant.name: Gigante esquelético
Skeletal Giant.publicNotes:
Los huesos reanimados de gigantes son excelentes siervos nigrománticos.

Los esqueletos reanimados son uno de los tipos de muerto viviente más comunes.

action->Broad Swipe.name: Barrido ancho
action->Broad Swipe.description: El gigante da dos Golpes de guja contra sendos enemigos adyacentes, ambos dentro de su alcance. Los dos ataques cuentan contra el penalizador por ataque múltiple del gigante, pero el penalizador no se incrementa hasta después de realizados.

action->Terrifying Charge.name: Carga terrorífica
action->Terrifying Charge.description:
El gigante da una Zancada y da un Golpe de cuernos, con un bonificador +4 por circunstancia al daño.

Si el Golpe acierta, el gigante trata de [[/act demoralize]]{Desmoralizar} al objetivo.

Skeletal Horse.name: Corcel esquelético
Skeletal Horse.publicNotes:
Estos esqueletos reanimados de caballos a veces son usados como monturas por otros muertos vivientes o por monstruos.

Los esqueletos animados son uno de los tipos más comunes de no muertos.

action->Gallop.name: Galope
action->Gallop.description: El corcel da dos Zancadas, con su velocidad aumentada en 10 pies (3 m).

action->Undead Steed.name: Montura muerta viviente
action->Undead Steed.description: Los muertos vivientes y las criaturas aliadas con ellos pueden @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Comandar} un corcel esquelético sin tener que hacer una prueba de habilidad.

Skeletal Hulk.name: Mole esquelética
Skeletal Hulk.publicNotes:
Los gigantes de tamaño Enorme y otras criaturas de grandes dimensiones dan lugar a esqueletos poderosos.

Los corceles esqueléticos son usados a veces como montura por monstruos o por otros muertos vivientes.

action->Broad Swipe.name: Barrido ancho
action->Broad Swipe.description: La mole esquelética da dos Golpes con sus garras contra sendos enemigos adyacentes, ambos dentro de su alcance. Los dos ataques cuentan contra el penalizador por ataque múltiple de la moile, pero el penalizador no se incrementa hasta después de realizados.

action->Massive Rush.name: Acometida colosal
action->Massive Rush.description: La mole da una Zancada y un Golpe de garra, con un bonificador +4 por circunstancia al daño. Si el Golpe impacta, la mole automáticamente empuja 10 pies (3 m) al objetivo.

Skeleton Guard.name: Esqueleto guardia
Skeleton Guard.publicNotes:
Los esbirros esqueléticos más comunes son meros guardias

Los esqueletos animados son uno de los tipos de muerto viviente más comunes.

Skulltaker.name: Skulltaker
Skulltaker.publicNotes: Swirling down from misty peaks and through howling mountain passes like an evil wind, the vortex of bones known as a skulltaker is a terrible manifestation of the delirium and agony experienced by doomed climbers and lost trailblazers just before they met their end. In some places, a skulltaker is also known as a saxra.
Skulltaker.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

action->Skeletal Lore.name: Skeletal Lore
action->Skeletal Lore.description:
A skulltaker taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the Skeletal Lore skill, which it can use to Recall Knowledge of any kind. In addition, it can speak and understand all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the skulltaker's home region).

The skulltaker can use Skeletal Lore as the primary skill check for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hp6Q64dl7xbdn4gQ]{Collective Memories} ritual, and it can cast collective memories without secondary casters.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name:
