Zecui.name: Zecui
Zecui.publicNotes:
Estos seres quitinosos solo pueden crecer hasta convertirse en adultos en el interior de una criatura anfitriona, por lo general un humanoide o un animal más grande. Cuando dichos anfitriones abundan, los zecuis pueden multiplicarse a un ritmo horripilante, sellando a sus anfitriones en cámaras subterráneas hasta que sus larvas llegan a la edad adulta. Sin embargo, en tiempos de vacas flacas, los zecuis adultos sacian su hambre devorando a estos anfitriones junto con cualquier larva desafortunada que están gestando, incapaces de ser infestados por sus propias crías.

Entre períodos de vigilia, los zecuis hibernan durante décadas en madrigueras o enterrados en el suelo. A veces una larva no incubada podría quedar enterrada de esta forma, esperando que un anfitrión vivo entrara en contacto con ella. Una vez una larva de zecui se ha gestado lo suficiente como para tomar el control del anfitrión, puede buscar seres más grandes y poderosos para que devoren a este, transfiriéndose a una fuente de comida más abundante.

action->Preserve Prey.name: Preservar presa
action->Preserve Prey.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura viva a 30 pies (9 m) o menos queda reducida a 0 Puntos de Golpe

Efecto El zecui canaliza vitalidad corrupta a la criatura desencadenante, que sigue @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}, pero no sufre el estado moribundo. Mientras dicha criatura permanece inconsciente, la energía residual hace una prueba de contrarrestar contra cualquier conjuro de vitalidad que cura a dicha criatura con un modificador [[/r 1d20+15 #Contrarrestar]]{+15} a contrarrestar.

action->Dual Stab.name: Puñalada doble
action->Dual Stab.description:
Frecuncia una vez por asalto

Efecto El zecui da dos Golpes de espada corta contra un objetivo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido}. Dichos ataques cuentan para el penalizador al ataque múltiple del zecui, que no se incrementa hasta después del segundo ataque.

action->Harden Chitin.name: Endurecer quitina
action->Harden Chitin.description: El zecui fusiona gran parte de su quitina en un caparazón metálico negro. Obtiene resistencia 5 a todo el daño (excepto mental y espiritual) hasta que lleva a cabo su siguiente acción de movimiento.

action->Spit Mucus.name: Escupir mucosidad
action->Spit Mucus.description: Una criatura impactada por el ataque de escupitajo del zecui queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizada} por la mucosidad infestada de larvas y pegada a la superficie más próxima hasta que [[/act escape dc=25]]{Huye (CD 25)}. Mientras dicha criatura está inmovilizada, se halla expuesta a las larvas de zecui al final de cada uno de sus turnos.

action->Zecui Larvae.name: Larvas de zecui
action->Zecui Larvae.description:
Tirada de salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Etapa 1 bultos visibles cuando se mueven las larvas pero sin efectos nocivos (1 día)

Etapa 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} (1 día)

Etapa 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 2} (1 día)

Etapa 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 3} y controlado por la larva de zecui (1 día)

Etapa 5 la criatura muere y el zecui adulto puede emerger del cadáver con una acción de interactuar.

Zephyr Hawk.name: Zephyr Hawk
Zephyr Hawk.publicNotes:
Zephyr hawks drift among the currents of the Plane of Air in great flocks. They delight in riding the air currents with no destination in mind.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. They're noted for being elusive, swift, and often difficult to detect due to being composed primarily of air.

action->Circling Attack.name: Circling Attack
action->Circling Attack.description: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

Zoaem.name: Zoaem
Zoaem.publicNotes:
These endlessly curious archons are formed from spinning wheels of golden light given corporeal shape. They serve as lookouts and mobile support troops for the archon legions, at times uniting to form powerful warriors of light called gestalts. Larger collectives of zoaems can even temporarily fuse into greater archons, approaching the power of the first zoaem, which broke itself apart to serve Heaven more efficiently.

Archons are guardians of Heaven and enemies of corruption. Before gods and their servants set foot in the celestial planes, archons already resided in Heaven, the original inhabitants of the realm. Upon meeting, the archons and divine angels quickly discovered they were of a kind, holding justice and righteousness in their hearts. An alliance was formed, and archons now serve as stalwart allies to all celestials and mortals they find worthy.

While the first archons coalesced from the immense seven-tiered mountain of Heaven, they choose willing and worthy Heaven-bound souls to join their ranks. These mortals hear and answer the call of a mysterious voice, manifesting in the Garden at the mountain's peak. There they swear to forever serve the cause of justice and transform into their new archon forms.

Though deeply concerned with defending mortal life and willing to sacrifice themselves in battle against fiends, archons often feel rote and inscrutable to others, and their forms can border on frightening and bizarre. For this reason, they often have issues with interacting with mortals, or with the free spirited azatas. Despite this, archons draw great strength from others, especially those who exemplify virtue.

Beyond their celestial allies, archons also maintain ancient ties with aeons. The inscrutable factions can still be seen working together to defend longforgotten secrets and enforce rules that predate mortal life. Archons explain these missions as necessary without further elaboration, leaving even their angelic allies frustrated with archons' obstinance.

action->Archon's Protection.name: Archon's Protection
action->Archon's Protection.description:
Trigger An enemy damages the archon's ally and both are within 15 feet of the archon

Effect The ally gains resistance 3 to all damage against the triggering damage and the archon can make a Strike against the enemy.

action->Behold!.name: Behold!
action->Behold!.description:
Frequency once per hour;

Effect The zoaem's rings and wings move in a complex pattern, mesmerizing creatures in the zoaem's choice of a @Template[emanation|distance:10] or a @Template[burst|distance:5] within 60 feet. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the zoaem for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or stunned for 1 round on a critical failure).

action->Light of Truth.name: Light of Truth
action->Light of Truth.description:
The zoaem shines an intense light of truth, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light} (@Check[reflex|dc:17] save) but in a @Template[line|distance:60]. Against creatures affected by this light, the zoaem and their allies gain a +1 status bonus to damage rolls and Recall Knowledge checks. The zoaem can't use Light of Truth again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Light of Truth]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.hekJBWsLxkt8zd7x]{Effect: Light of Truth}

Zombie Brute.name: Zombi bruto
Zombie Brute.publicNotes:
Algunas mejoras nigrománticas conceden a este gigante zombi un poder incrementado.

El único deseo de un zombi es consumir a los vivos. Estos heraldos de la muerte descerebrados y tambaleantes solo se detienen cuando son destruidos.

action->Slow.name: Lento
action->Slow.description: Un zombi está permanentemente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} y no puede usar reacciones.

Zombie Hulk.name: Zombi mole
Zombie Hulk.publicNotes:
Estos enormes horrores se alzan a partir de cadáveres monstruosos y gigantescos.

El único deseo de un zombi es consumir a los vivos. Estos heraldos de la muerte descerebrados y tambaleantes solo se detienen cuando son destruidos.

condition->Slowed.description: Tienes menos acciones. Lentificado siempre incluye un valor. Cuando recuperas tus acciones, reduce el número recuperado en tu valor de lentificado. Como quiera que recuperas acciones al inicio de tu turno, no pierdes acciones de inmediato si te lentifican durante tu turno.

action->Slow.name: Lento
action->Slow.description: Un zombi está permanentemente lentificado 1 y no puede usar reacciones.

action->Corpse Throwing.name: Arrojar cadáveres
action->Corpse Throwing.description: Un zombi mole puede arrojar cadáveres Medianos o más pequeños contra sus enemigos. Para este menester, también puede arrojar zombis Medianos o más pequeños, que sufren el mismo daño que el objetivo al que aciertan. Un zombi que sobrevive a ser arrojado queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbado}.

action->Wide Swing.name: Barrido ancho
action->Wide Swing.description: El zombi mole da dos Golpes de trozo de carne contra enemigos diferentes dentro de su alcance.

Zombie Shambler.name: Zombi tambaleante
Zombie Shambler.publicNotes:
Un zombi tambaleante es un horror de movimientos lentos que resulta muy peligroso en grupos grandes.

Un zombi sólo desea consumir a los vivos. Estos heraldos de la muerte tambaleantes y descerebrados sólo se detienen cuando son destruidos.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Mandíbulas
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requisitos El zombi tiene una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada}.

action->Slow.name: Lento
action->Slow.description: Un zombi está permanentemente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} y no puede usar reacciones.

Zyss Serpentfolk.name: Zyss Serpentfolk
Zyss Serpentfolk.publicNotes:
Even the least among zyss serpentfolk consider themselves greater than any mammal. Their magical abilities, most notably their telepathy, are all the reason they need to hold this view. And it's true enough that the instinctual skill and magic of any zyss is enough to best the average human.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.
Zyss Serpentfolk.saveDetails: +4 status to will saves vs. mental, +1 status to all saves vs. magic
